Paper: thick white paper with black ink
Mentions: Isabel Dato, Adelia Acevedo, Joan Miró
Notes: mentions the receipt of a telegram from her mother in the first line

Mentions: Josefina de Atucha, León-Paul Fargue, George-Henri Rivière, Jacque Lacan, Pierre Drieu de la Rochelle, Mme. Letellier
Notes: mentions that Drieu de la Rochelle will read to her in his apartment on the following day; describes a dinner party at Josephina's home (with Fargue, Rivière, and Lacan) the previous night; telephone conversations with Lacan ; describes an outting to Gourgaud's to see a series of paintings

Paper: creme-colored paper with black ink (the first page has some slight damage from a burn)
Mentions: Pancha, Drieu, Isabel Dato, Ramón Fernández, Francis Poulnec, Delia del Carril, Jacque Lacan, Thérèse d'Hinnisdaël, Lucien Daudet
Notes: mentions a previous letter she received from Angélica; also a telegram received from Pancha; use of a throat disinfected (adminsitered by Lacan) for a cold; Drieu was there the previous day and that same day; mentions a Poulnec ballet she will see; various people will visit her tomorrow (Dato, Fernández, Delia, Lacan)

Mentions: Ernest Ansermet, Marie-Louise Bousquet, Waldo Frank
Notes: describes her disappointment at Poulnec's ballet ; mentions the "APO" (Asociación del Profesorado Orquestal); mentions a letter she received from Waldo Frank

Paper: creme-colored paper with black ink
Mentions: Marie-Louise Bousquet, Leo Ferrero, Henry de Montherlant, Guy de Pourtalès, Roberto Desnos, Michel Leiris, Jean Monnet, Manuel Ángeles Ortiz, Ansermet, Lacan
Notes: first encounters with Ferrero, Montherland, Pourtalès ; Ferrero will come over for dinner on "Tuesday" ; On Monday she will have dinner with Ramón Fernández and Drieu ; having tea with Mme. Bousquet "tomorrow" with the group from Documents (1929-1930), literary journal ; mentions that she had dinner with Drieu, Isabel Dato, Delia and Ortiz the previous night ; comments how she fights a great deal with Lacan, but that they might go to Chartres on Sunday ; love of the new Chanel line of clothing

Paper: creme-colored paper with black ink
Mentions: Jean Cocteau, Delia, Ramón Gómez de la Serna
Notes: discusses her dislike of Cocteau's work (La voix humaine) and provides a summary of the work itself

Paper: creme-colored paper with black ink
Mentions: Cocteau, Paul Eluard, Marie-Louise-Bousquet, Jean Desbordes, Fargue, Hélène Vacaresco, Lacan, Valentine Hugo, Ansermet
Notes: continues her previous letter about Cocteau's work; will have lunch at Cocteau's along with Ramón (de la Serna?) next week; relishes Fargue's sense of humor; potential of going to Brussels with Ansermet the following week; fight with Lacan over Cocteau's work; going to Hugo's home on "Monday"

Paper: creme-colored paper with slight foxing; blue ink; "via Aéropostale" diagonally printed in the top left-hand corner in between a red (top) and blue (bottom) stripe
Mentions: José Ortega y Gasset, Marie-Louise Bousquet, Leo Ferrero, Anna de Noailles, Madame Lobre, María de Atucha, Conde de Cuevas de Vera (Carlos), Emile Ludwig, Delia, Fargue, Cocteau, Drieu
Notes: describes the lunch that all of these individuals had "yesterday"; detail of Anna's attire; Ortega discussed several of Sappho's poems; long monologue about the sun; V. invited Ortega, Drieu and Ferrero to have dinner with her that night; addressed to "todos"

Paper: creme-colored thick paper; black ink
Mentions: Delia, Fany, Albert Kahn, Leonard Elmhirst, Tagore, Maupassant,
Notes: describes the long and arduous car trip to Cap Martin (Delia, Fany, and Victoria); first went to Lyon, then travelent to Montelimar, had lunch the next day in Avignon; talks a bit about Tagore and his secretary, Leonard Elmhirst; mentions 3 Chanel suits that she is sending for Angélica and various types of fabric for Silvina; addressed to parents and siblings

Paper: light blue paper with blue ink
Mentions: Otto Kahn, Waldo Frank, Delia, Eisenstein (director of Potemkin), conde Leornin, Alex Wuthenau, Baba de Faucigny-Lucinge, Taylor Gordon
Notes: describes a trip to Long Island; talks about film; mentions what surprises her most about the states (in comparison with Europe) is the sense of SPACIOUSNESS; saw a catedral in Harlem; the letter is addressed to "queridos"

Paper: white paper with blue and black ink
Mentions: María Rosa Oliver, Waldo Frank, Fany, Diógenes de Urquiza, María Luisa Ocampo de Urquiza
Notes: describes her first night back at Mar del Plata

Paper: creme colored paper (thin) with blue ink

Notes: describes her trip to Ojai (close to Santa Barbara); mentions conversations with Krishnamurti and Raja Gopal; date between 10/05/[1943-1948]

Paper: light blue paper with a blue logo at the top of the page ("Claridge's, Brook Street"); blue ink

Notes: went to a reception last night that was given in her honor at the British Council (although it appears to have been a rather sad night for her)

Paper: thin creme-colored paper with blue ink

Notes: describes her lunch and outing with Victoria Kent; wants to invite her to BsAs to give some lectures; also addressed to Pancha

Mentions: William Faulkner, Proust
Notes: She is reading Wild Palms and absolutely hates it
reading Dream of the Red Chamber
notes that José could announce her poem for the next issue of Sur; begins her continually lament to forgive her for how horrible all of her letters are
describes her obsession with the idea of suicide; recounts how much she misses José (Bianco); reveals a great deal of her internal suffering

Mentions: Chopin, Virginia Woolf
Notes: talks about bad news and horrible things that are happening in the world; comments how you can't even play Chopin in Poland
Silvina provides José with some notes on the "nouvelle" that he is writing; states that most important thing when you are writing is not the "I," but the work itself;
she critics a horrible book of his; discussion of verse vs. prose; talks about a blind friend of hers

Mentions: Rilke, Waldo Frank, Arturo Serrano Plaja, Enrique Amorim, Lanuza, Caillois
Notes: she sends him a book (Bete dans la jungle); has a long list of complains about the most recent number of Sur; compares Sur to Caras y Caretas

Mentions: Martínez Estrada
Notes: it seems that Bianco has abandoned his book; describes a work by Martínez Estrada, Un libro de poemas, that she will pay to have printed

A mí me los han de presentar cuando se presenta la ocasión y he de firmarlos yo. Nadie más que yo."

Paper: tissue thin white paper; black ink

Location_sent: 820 Fifth Avenue, New York City, New York

Nunca habían visto la revista y estaban encantadas"

Location_sent: Park Lane Hotel, London, United Kingdom

Mentions: Yvette (and her children)
Notes: visit to Kew Gardens; once again mentions the problem of paper: "No me han traido más papel (estoy en el comedor)"; mentions her hatred of the cities: "Las ciudades me ahogan totalmente"; mentions her desire to go to the British Museum

Location_sent: Park Lane Hotel, London, United Kingdom
Paper: Park Lane Hotel stationery; blue ink
Mentions: los Ortega (Pepito y su mujer), Yvette, Madariaga, Ansermet, Graham Greene, Yvonne ("girlfriend" de Greene), Evelyn Stuart (secretaria del pobre don Melitón, o Mandrake), Vera Macarov
Notes: mentions Franco's dictatorship -- according to Pepito Ortega -- is worse than Perón's; mentions how expensive the paper is that she is writing on (for mailing): "este papel es muy 'expensive'"; addressed to "queridas chicas"

Location_sent: Hotel de la Trémoille, Paris, France
Paper: plain white paper (identical to 8.5 x 11 printer paper); blue ink
Mentions: Obligado, Neruda, René Maheu, Malraux, Roger Caillois, Sylvia Molloy, Gudela Bismark, Starhenberg, Nora Gregor, Cosima, Brunilda, Emmanuel de Sieyès (François de Veynes, León Regis = pseudonyms)
Notes: discusses meeting with representatives from the "Conseil Généneral": "Resumen: Los representantes de México, Chile pusieron reparos. Pidieron aclaraciones sobre el programa, quisieron darle largas al asunto. Según Obligado porque México no ve con placer que en otro país de habla española se establezca un centro que no hay aún en ninguna nación del contnente hispanoamericano"; mentions the support she receives from India ("cien por ciento (como siempre)"); mentions a sum of 25,000 dollars for upkeep at Villa Ocampo and Villa Victoria; also addressed to Fryda

Paper: thin white paper (identical to 8.5 x 11 paper); blue ink
Notes: also addressed to Maria Luisa and Fryda

Paper: postcard
Mentions: Jorita
Notes: "En este paraíso terrenal, lleno de maravillosaos árboles, y polanses (?¿) y agua y una preciosa casa"

Paper: postcard (bright purple with an image of a train that says "Just when I was getting used to Yesterday...Along came today"); blue ink
Notes: "tengo mucho que contarte"

Paper: postcard (bright green with a border of the translation of "hello!" in various languages; in the center of the border it reads: "Consider yourself greeted"); blue ink
Notes: just contains the name of Alberto Salas and "Cariños, V"

Paper: postcart (bright orange with "Please live as long as possible -- I prefer a world with you in it"); blue ink
Notes: Financial problems with Sur: "¿Por qué decís que tengo plata para la revista? No la tengo. Por eso no sale como antes."; grateful for all of the help her friends have given her (with regard to the journal); mentions she is no longer as able as she used to be (for publishing?): "Pero la verdad es que yo ya no tengo manera de hacer lo que hacía antes"

Paper: light blue paper (thin with visible chain and wire lines); blue ink
Mentions: Dohms (¿?), Wolfgang Wagner (nieto), Siegfried (Winifried), Hitler
Notes: visit to Wagner's home (Wahnfried); switches ink in the middle of the letter: "se me acabó  la tinta de mi Schaefer - esta que uso es imposible"; describes a play she went to see; discussion of familial problems with the Wagners (esp. over his last will and testament); mentions going to Munich the following day to see "algún castillo de Ludwig" (Neuschwanstein); also addressed to Fryda

Location_sent: Hotel de la Trémoille, Paris, France
Paper: "Hotel de la Trémoille" stationery; blue ink
Mentions: Sigfried, María, Silvia
Notes: Angélica's bronchitis; mentions the birth of a child (of a woman named María) and the "casamiento civil" of this same woman the day before (!!!); mentions how she wrote Angélica a very long letter in Germany, but that she never sent it because it might serve well as an ARTICLE: "Te escribí una larga [carta] de Alemania - Pero no la mandé porque pensé que podía servirme para un artículo"

Location_sent: Hotel de la Trémoille, Paris, France
Paper: "Hotel de la Trémoille" stationery; black ink
Mentions: Daan, María, Mimi
Notes: It seems that the baby is named "Florencia" - Mimi will be the madrina

Paper: light blue, thick paper (8.5. x 11), folded; black ink
Mentions: Alain Malraux, Sylvia Molloy, André Malraux, Victoria Kent, Silvina Bullrich
Notes: "He llegado aquí, para respirar, pero no hay aire"; thinking about going to Nice on the 19th of August; mentions wanting to see an exhibit ("de S-Paul de Vence"); also addressed to Fryda

Paper: light blue paper; blue ink
Mentions: Mimi, Yvette, Silvina, Roger
Notes: Victoria is complaining again about how badly the heat affects her and how there is no air conditioning anywhere in Paris; mentions that she is going to go to Bagatelle to "walk a bit"; also addressed to Fryda

Paper: light blue paper; blue ink
Mentions: Fryda, Soledad, Roger, Camus
Notes: mentions how the day prior she went to three different theatres to see three different films; "Como verás, París o está agradable y no sé lo que daría (literalmente) por estar en Mar del Plata"; "Neuschvanstein es un poco Walt Disney"; "Voy a escribir un artículo para La Nación...que se titulará De Bagatelle a Neuschvanstein"

Paper: white paper (smaller) with blue ink
Mentions: Obligado, Tito Olivere, Los Bioy,
Notes: discussion of a necessary inventory: "No quiereo (y se lo dije a Obligado) que toquen mis papeles - Estos no quedaran en V. Ocampo"; discussion of what will happen to various paintings of their family (Mama Clara, Tata Ocampo, etc.); Victoria didn't to get in the middle of things so she didn't ask for any of the paintings for Villa Ocampo; "pienso hacer algo en alguna universidad de U.S.A. con las cartas. Pero no quiero a[un decirlo, ni siquiera a Obligado"; also addressed to Fryda

Paper: white paper with black ink
Mentions: Louise, Valentine Huge, Ravel, Fryda, Rosita Bengolea
Notes: mentions writing an article on Equus (by Sahffer); went to see Sherlock Holmes: "Decile a Rosita Bengolea que he pensado que Lupi podría hacer un excelente Sherlock Holmes (teatro). Si le interesa, me gustaría comprar los derechos enseguida"; on the back of the letter -- in blue ink (handwritten) -- Ocampo writes: "The Royal Shakespeare Compnay con John Wood de Sherlock ¡ojo! ¡qué cast!"

Paper: light blue paper with blue ink
Mentions: María Louisa Bombal, Manolo Jiménez (ex secretario de Julián Huxley), Madeleine Malraux, Ortega
Notes: 3 physical pieces of paper, but written on both sides of the page = 5 pages of text; Madeleine le da una invitación a un concierto esta noche; also addressed to Fryda

Location_sent: Hotel de la Trémoille, Paris, France
Paper: Hotel de la Tremoille letterhead (white paper with blue letterhead) ; blue ink
Mentions: Susan Sontag, Edguardo Cozarinsky, Soledad (Ortega)
Notes: discussion of North American P.E.N.; describes Sontag as a North American writer; Sontag asked Cozarinsky to introduce the two of them; Sontag had wanted to meet Ocampo for some time...; also addressed to Fryda

Paper: plain white paper (identical to 8.5 x 11 printer paper); black ink
Mentions: Soledad Ortega, Françoise Giroud, Noailles, Michaux, Roger Caillois
Notes: Ocampo notes that she has to go to London "tomorrow" (i.e. March 2, 1975): "quiero estar allí una semana y volver para tomar el avión el 18"; Michaux visited her the day before (Feb. 28?); she's currently at the hair salon while writing this letter (!): "Estoy en la peluquería, y no me han dado más que 1 hoja" (explanation of why this letter is only one page); also addressed to Fryda

Location_sent: Park Lane Hotel, London, United Kingdom
Paper: Park Lane Hotel stationery; blue ink
Mentions: Yvette, Edmonde Charles-Roux, Gabrielle Chanel
Notes: mentions her visit to the "nueva casa" of the British Council the day before; mentions seeing "Peter Pan" (by Barrie): "'What every woman knows' Empieza en el año 1905 y se siente tal simpatía hacia la mujer y hacia sus modestas...reclamaciones que tengo ganas de traducirla"; mentions two books stores she will visit to find a copy (Hatchards (near Piccadilly) and Fayles); currently reading about Gabrielle Chanel in L'irríguliere de Edmonde Charles-Roux; mentions the "invasión japonesa" in London...; discussion of China's rules about only having 2 children and Mao; also addressed to Fryda

Location_sent: Park Lane Hotel, London, United Kingdom
Paper: White paper with a black and white sketch of London scenery (big ben, london bridge, etc.) in the upper right-hand corner of the page; blue-black ink
Mentions: The Lawrences, Samy Oliver
Notes: mentions she will be leaving tomorrow morning (i.e. 03/14/1975) for Heathrow to travel to Paris; joy of being in London: "cuando estoy en Londrés me olvido de todo lo que quería hacer, tal es la felicidad de estar en esta ciudad"

Paper: thin cornflower blue paper with blue ink
Mentions: Soledad Ortega, Madeleine Malraux, George Balanchine, Ravel
Notes: deciding what to do about travel; Soledad offered her place in Madrid; Madeleine her place in New York; mentions how close she feels to Madeleine; also addressed to Fryda

Location_sent: Hotel de la Trémoille, Paris, France
Paper: Hotel de la Tremoille letterhead (white paper with blue letterhead) ; blue ink
Mentions: Benoite Groult, Alain Malraux
Notes: mentions reading Groult's book Ainsi soit-elle; compares Islamic men to "unos verdaderos cerdos sin conpostura"; mentions the death of Onasis; cites passages from her book at length; mentions the publication of an article of hers about Argentina; mentions her desire to go to Nice for 2 days; also mentions someone named "Cado de Rubenstein (¿?) and Florence"; also addressed to Fryda

Paper: Telegram ("Servicio Telegráfico Internacional")
Notes: relays her flight information to Angélica: "Llego Vuelo Iberia 9931 Miércoles 26 hora 21,55"

Paper: thin white paper with blue ink
small rectangular calling card of Victoria Ocampo; creme-colored, thick cardstock with "Victoria Ocampo" written in all caps in the center (in black)

Notes: a short note to Sylvia on her calling card; on the reverse of the card, Sylvia has written "got lovely green scarf from Victoria. Feb. 9 46"

Paper: SUR letterhead (thin creme-colored paper); black ink
Mentions: Victoria Ocampo
Notes: official payment for perhaps books that Ocampo purchased from Shakespeare & Co.
